title: Population
description: Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2100, based on data and estimates from different sources.

title: Gross domestic product (GDP)
description: Total economic output of a country or region per year. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
source: Bolt and van Zanden – Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

title: Annual CO₂ emissions
description: Annual total emissions of carbon dioxide (CO₂), excluding land-use change, measured in million tonnes.

title: CO₂ emissions per capita
description: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) emissions from burning fossil fuels and industrial processes. This includes emissions from transport, electricity generation, and heating, but not land-use change.
source: Global Carbon Budget (2025) [https://globalcarbonbudget.org/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Annual CO₂ emissions per GDP (kg per international-$)
description: Annual total emissions of carbon dioxide (CO₂), excluding land-use change, measured in kilograms per dollar of GDP (2011 international-$).
source: Global Carbon Budget (2025) [https://globalcarbonbudget.org/]; Bolt and van Zanden – Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

title: Annual CO₂ emissions per unit energy (kg per kilowatt-hour)
description: Annual total emissions of carbon dioxide (CO₂), excluding land-use change, measured in kilograms per kilowatt-hour of primary energy consumption.
source: Global Carbon Budget (2025) [https://globalcarbonbudget.org/]; U.S. Energy Information Administration - International Energy Data (2025) [https://www.eia.gov/opendata/bulkfiles.php]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]

title: Primary energy consumption per capita
source: U.S. Energy Information Administration - International Energy Data (2025) [https://www.eia.gov/opendata/bulkfiles.php]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: Primary energy consumption per GDP
source: U.S. Energy Information Administration - International Energy Data (2025) [https://www.eia.gov/opendata/bulkfiles.php]; Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2025) [https://www.energyinst.org/statistical-review/]; Bolt and van Zanden – Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]

title: GDP per capita
description: Gross domestic product (GDP) divided by population, measuring the average economic output per person.
source: Bolt and van Zanden – Maddison Project Database 2023 [https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2023]; Population based on various sources (2024) [https://ourworldindata.org/population-sources]

title: CO2 Kaya Identity
description: CO2 emissions calculated using the Kaya Identity method.
source: Calculated from Our World in Data - Regions (2024) and other sources listed above

title: CO2 Kaya Identity Difference
description: Difference in CO2 emissions calculated using the Kaya Identity method.
source: Calculated from Our World in Data - Regions (2024) and other sources listed above

title: CO2 Kaya Identity Difference Percentage
description: Percentage difference in CO2 emissions calculated using the Kaya Identity method.
source: Calculated from Our World in Data - Regions (2024) and other sources listed above
